title: What has the black community appropriated from the Jewish community? - Quora

response.answer_text: What has the black community appropriated from the Jewish community? Who cares? Appropriation is something that people who feel they’re getting the short end of the stick worry about. Social winners don’t care about this stuff. Sure, tell everyone you’re the real Jews (wink, wink).[1] Same goes for New Age Kabbalah[2] and “faux mitzvahs.”[3] We don’t care. It’s a compliment, right up until the point that you try to appropriate our lives rather than our traditions. Then, in the words of a great Jewish superhero,[4] “It’s clobberin’ time.” Footnotes[1] Black Hebrew Israelites - Wikipedia[2] Kabbalah Centre - Wikipedia[3] New teen trend: ‘Faux Mitzvahs’[4] Thing (comics) - Wikipedia

And they also don't talk about how Ham wasn't cursed and only Canaan was cursed. And they also don't talk about the fact we aren't black but are brown. We see this Jewish nation as a mongrel people, and we remember the mixing in Ezra and remember many people blocked from the heritage and we look at them and see exactly that. And we go and ask them what happened to Israel that went into Africa? If I am mixed with blood of Indians and Brittish is that Ammonite, is that Hittite, is that Canaanite? But are the Jews who follow the Babylonian Talmud Ammorites? Us blacks aren't actually following them at all, we don't acknowledge them as Israel whatsoever. This is why we don't join them, remember in Deuteronomy we were commanded not to make pacts with these people, and most of us haven't.
